title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
New Covid-19 lockdowns in China helped drag oil prices back below $100 a barrel, casting yet more uncertainty on a global economic expansion hamstrung by war in Ukraine, rising inflation and the end of stimulus.

U.S. stocks jumped as the drop in oil prices eased investors' concerns about inflation ahead of the conclusion of the Fed's policy meeting on Wednesday. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow rose 2.1%, 2.9% and 1.8%, respectively.

---

The SEC is conducting a sweeping investigation into potential conflicts of interest at the nation's largest accounting firms.

---

Raskin withdrew from consideration as the Fed's top banking regulator, the White House said, after Republicans and Democrat Manchin opposed her nomination.

---

The Senate confirmed Shalanda Young as OMB director, the first Black woman to hold the position.

---

Intel said it would invest $36 billion in semiconductor production and research across Europe.

---

U.S.-listed companies are unveiling plans to repurchase their own shares at a record pace.

---

Airlines said travel demand is roaring back and believe fliers will pay up to cover carriers' rising fuel bills.

---

VW is close to deciding whether to build an electric pickup truck in the U.S.

---

AMC is buying 22% of mining company Hycroft, venturing away from its core movie-theater operations.
